items.title: 'It's just a nightmare': No clinical guidelines on quitting steroids as use explodes in Australia
items.description: A rising number of Australians are using steroids. But one expert says a lack of knowledge and widespread stigma make it tough to get clinical support.

items.title: 'Battle conditions': More than a quarter of Sydney to Hobart fleet retires
items.description: Crews have been battling challenging conditions, damage and sea sickness as the leading yachts are expected to arrive in Hobart later today.

items.title: Labor identity fighting for life after alleged assault in Perth
items.description: Tim Picton, who spearheaded the campaign behind WA Labor's landslide 2021 victory, is in a critical condition in hospital after he was allegedly assaulted in Northbridge.

items.title: How the internet reacted to England winning the Boxing Day Test
items.description: The English swashed their buckles and came out on top in a Boxing Day Test that was played in fast-forward. Here's how the internet reacted.

items.title: How teens stay connected to friends, family overseas without social media
items.description: Sydney teenager Ilia Kyrychenko was relieved to delete his accounts after the social media ban, but the change is making it more difficult to connect with his loved ones in Ukraine.

items.title: AI is changing after-school parenting for many Chinese families
items.description: AI is becoming a regular presence at homework time in many Chinese households. Experts say where families draw the line matters more than the technology itself.

items.title: Magic mushroom use rises despite concerns of rare paralysis syndrome
items.description: Wood-lover paralysis is a poorly understood syndrome related to consuming a native species of magic mushroom, with sufferers experiencing weakness and difficulty breathing in some instances.

items.title: Mum of four-year-old who drowned pleads for safer pool fences
items.description: A woman is calling for tougher pool fencing regulations after her daughter crawled through a faulty fence and drowned in a neighbour’s pool.

items.title: Every time Sonya saves a dingo pup, she breaks the law
items.description: When Sonya sees a black-and-tan dingo, she feels a connection to family and Country, but many landholders see them as livestock-killing pests. Can graziers and dingoes co-exist?

items.title: Forget brat summer, the vibe shift is here and it's terrifying
items.description: From the rise of misinformation and AI to escalating political tensions, vast economic disparity, and the erosion of social bonds, the vibe shift is now understood as a deep, unsettling change in our collective reality.

items.title: My mentors helped me develop confidence. Now I'm giving back
items.description: Other people with lived experience of blindness gave Nas Campanella the confidence to navigate life. Her mentee is enjoying similar benefits.

items.title: Russian drones, missiles pound Ukraine ahead of Zelenskyy-Trump meeting
items.description: Russia has attacked Ukraine with hundreds of missiles and drones ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said would be a crucial meeting with Donald Trump to work out a deal to end nearly four years of war.

items.title: Police investigate report of man with alleged antisemitic tattoo
items.description: Police overseeing the response to the Bondi terror attack are investigating after a man was seen at a NSW beach allegedly showing a tattoo of a banned Nazi symbol.

items.title: Parts of Queensland bracing for heavy rain and potential flooding
items.description: Holiday travellers are being urged to check road closures before setting off on their journey, with parts of the state expecting rain into the middle of next week.

items.title: Climate a bigger threat to biodiversity than renewables, experts say
items.description: As the green energy boom gathers pace, experts say climate change is a bigger threat to biodiversity than wind farms and other renewables projects.

items.title: Step up and try your luck on our Hard Quiz tournament
items.description: Looking to settle who is the smartest in your family? Challenge them to a Hard Quiz tournament: five rounds, 50 questions.

items.title: Council watchdog closes years-long probe without finishing report
items.description: The integrity agency tasked with keeping the local government sector in check is under fire after an ABC investigation raised questions over whether it was properly empowered to carry out its core functions.

items.title: Umpire shortage lowering standards, increasing injuries, ex-umpires say
items.description: Jared Collins has officiated nearly a thousand NT footy games, but says an ongoing dispute between AFLNT and its umpires has forced him to hang up the whistle.

items.title: Australians are drinking less alcohol — except for one age group
items.description: Health-conscious Australians may be thinking twice about having that first or second beer, but not all of us are getting the message when it comes to alcohol and risky drinking.

items.title: Woman killed, man critically injured, after Quakers Hill stabbing
items.description: A man has been arrested after the death of a woman and the stabbing of another man in Sydney's north-west, with emergency services called to a Quakers Hill home just before 5am on Sunday after reports of a disturbance.

items.title: Australia belted, England vindicated and Test cricket wounded in MCG farce
items.description: As England deservedly celebrates a long-awaited Test win in Australia, everyone else involved counts the cost of a farcical and damaging two-day disaster at the MCG.

items.title: Heat call on lightning-fast debutant in rollicking BBL win
items.description: Injury to Shaheen Afridi leaves debutant Tom Balkin to bowl the final over, and the 21-year-old delivers to help Brisbane Heat to a seven-run BBL win over Adelaide Strikers.

items.title: Queensland triathlete making history and inspiring a new generation
items.description: Matthew Hauser has always dreamed of becoming a triathlete. After achieving incredible feats this year, the world champion is now eyeing a spot on the Australian Olympic squad.

items.title: How AI and 'smart tourism' is changing the way we travel
items.description: Will new technology lead to streamlined service and stress-free travel, or will it fundamentally change tourism and tourist destinations?

items.title: 'Traumatised' residents return after Christmas Day fire forced them to flee
items.description: Residents have begun returning to their homes after a bushfire burning south-east of Perth forced them to flee on Christmas Day.
